title: Sydney rapper ChillinIT films himself rolling joints at courthouse
text:
A rapper has filmed himself appearing to roll a joint during a court hearing.

Sydney artist Chillinit, real name Blake James Turnell, was at Sutherland Local Court on Tuesday facing a charge of driving while disqualified.

The 25-year-old appeared to be cutting dried plant matter resembling marijuana in the video shared to his 200,000 Instagram followers.

With the video he played a song by Kachafire entitled Collie Herb Man.

Sydney rapper Chillinit filmed himself carrying marijuana at a court appearance at Sutherland Local Court on Tuesday (pictured)

Turnell (pictured) appeared to be cutting dried plant matter resembling marijuana in the video shared to his 200,000 Instagram followers

'Rolling joints at the courthouse like IDGAF (I don't give a f*ck),' he captioned the post.

Earlier Turnell was seen walking into the courthouse carrying a sealed bag inside his bumbag.

On September 21, Turnell allegedly drove a black Chrysler while holding a disqualified licence in Hurstville, in Sydney's south.

The rapper received bail under instructions not to occupy the front seat of a vehicle.

Court documents revealed the rapper had previously faced a string of other charges.

The rapper (pictured) was accused of driving a car in September on a disqualified licence

'The accused has a number of charges in recent times and he has a further disqualified driving charge pending before the court,' the documents said, The Daily Telegraph reported.

'Although traffic-related the accused does not seem to understand the seriousness of continuing to offend,' court documents said.

'It's likely that a custodial sentence may be imposed if there is a continuation of driving offences.'

Photos posted to Turnell's Instagram show him appearing to smoke marijuana in various places.

He has more than 60,000 subscribers on YouTube and is due to play in one of Australia's largest music festivals Fomo, in January.

The case is due again in court on November 5.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Calibre Artist Management on behalf of Chillinit for comment.
description: Sydney artist Chillinit, real name Blake James Turnell,  was at Sutherland Local Court on Tuesday facing a charge of driving while disqualified.
authors: Eliza Mcphee For Daily Mail Australia
